item.title: Assassin’s Creed Hexe Director is Leaving Ubisoft
item.content:encoded:
Assassin’s Creed Hexe’s creative director will be leaving Ubisoft, with the new Head of Content taking his place.

Vantage Studio recently announced new leadership for the Assassin’s Creed franchise, with a trio tasked with taking the brand forward. The new roles included Head of the Assassin’s Creed Brand, Head of Content, and Head of Production Excellence, with the Head of Content serving as the new creative director on Hexe.

Assassin’s Creed Hexe Development Will Continue With New Creative Director

According to a VGC report, a spokesperson revealed that Assassin’s Creed Hexe’s creative director, Clint Hocking, will be leaving Ubisoft. The spokesperson also revealed that development on the title will continue “with a seasoned team” and the experience will be “something distinctive within the Assassin’s Creed franchise.” More information will be shared by the studio “in the future.”

The report states that there is a new creative director for Assassin’s Creed Hexe: Jean Guesdon, the new Head of Content for the franchise. Guesdon is an experienced creative director, having served in that role on both Assassin’s Creed: Origins and Assassin’s Creed: Black Flag.

Most recently, we were informed that Assassin’s Creed Codename Hexe had hired its lead scriptwriter, who has worked on the scripts for Origins, Valhalla, and Mirage. Additionally, what is known about the game is that it will be more like an old-school Assassin’s Creed game, with you playing as a female protagonist named Elsa, set in Central Europe during the 16th-century Holy Roman Empire.

In other news, Ubisoft has confirmed that two Far Cry games and multiple Assassin’s Creed games are in development. Additionally, a Black Flag Remaster art book surfaced online recently. item.title: PlayStation Plus Free Monthly Games for March 2026 Revealed
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation Plus free monthly games for Essential members in March 2026 have been officially revealed.

Just a few days ago, a report arrived revealing the headliner for PS Plus monthly games this month, which was said to be PGA Tour 2K25. Now, the official announcement has arrived, and the game reported on has been confirmed, along with 3 more games to add to your library.

PlayStation Plus Essential Members Receive 4 Games in March

As confirmed, PlayStation Plus free monthly games have PGA Tour 2K25 as the headliner for the month of March. Players will be able to compete in The PGA Championship, The U.S. Open, and The Open Championship to make their PGA TOUR 2K debut. The game will be available only on PS5. Other highlights include The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road Collection and Monster Hunter Rise. Check out the full list below:

  • PGA Tour 2K25
  • Monster Hunters Rise
  • Slime Rancher 2
  • The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road Collection

The Elder Scrolls Online Gold Road Edition provides players access to all major Chapter zones, biomes, and quest arcs across Tamriel, but the 2025 content pass is not included. Additionally, PlayStation Plus Essential and Extra members can get a one-month trial of Discord Nitro, and Premium members can get three months.

All of the upcoming PS Plus games will be available to add to your library between Tuesday, March 3, and Monday, April 6. The last day to add February’s PS Plus Games is March 2, and it includes games like Undisputed, Subnautica: Below Zero, and more.

In other news, PlayStation 5 was the best-selling hardware in the United States in January 2026. Additionally, Sony has announced the closure of Bluepoint Games. item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Re-Release Launches to ‘Mostly Negative’ Reviews on Steam
item.content:encoded:
The original Final Fantasy 7 has re-released on Steam, and it doesn’t seem to be faring well with players due to some issues, as reviews have dropped to ‘Mostly Negative.’

For those unaware, Square Enix announced last month that Final Fantasy 7 will be re-released on Steam, replacing the 2013 version. Today, the new version has arrived with some brand-new features; however, these seem to be causing many gameplay issues, which are hampering the experience at launch.

Original Final Fantasy 7 Re-Release on Steam Seemingly Riddled with Issues

To understand the problem, players will first have to know the new features that have arrived with the original Final Fantasy 7’s re-release on Steam. Players have received a 3x Speed mode, which allows them to battle, travel, and participate in select events at three times the speed. There’s also an option to turn off random battle encounters, a Battle Enhancement mode that allows players to recover HP/MP during battles, max out the Limit gauge, and an Autosave feature.

Spotted by GamesRadar+, the majority of complaints seem to be with the game’s new speed-up feature, with players highlighting issues like “combat speed is completely broken”, “the FPS limit has been increased from 15 to 30, doubling the speed of fights and actions but without adapting the animations so the actions desyncs with the audio,” and more. Some others have mentioned issues with overlays, textures, and screen tearing.

However, some reviewers have pointed out that Square Enix was prompt in releasing a patch the same day to fix the combat speed issue. But will this be enough to get the review rating back up?

In other news, Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade on the Switch 2 is not a PS4 port. Additionally, the multiplatform release will not compromise the graphics in FF7 Remake Part 3.
